snippet: The Chrysler Corporation won approval today in California for mass production of an electric version of its popular Dodge Caravan mini-van. It is the first leading United States auto maker to meet the state's 1998 zero-emission rule.    The 1993 m...
lead_paragraph: The Chrysler Corporation won approval today in California for mass production of an electric version of its popular Dodge Caravan mini-van. It is the first leading United States auto maker to meet the state's 1998 zero-emission rule. The 1993 model five-passenger Caravan was certified for sale by the California Air Resources Board four years ahead of the 1998 deadline set by the agency for the sale of a set percentage of pollution-free vehicles in California.
